sub_title: Jr. Project Leader Area Development | MSc Graduate Global Business & Sustainability
summary:
Combining my passion for sustainability and my business background has led me to pursue a master's degree in Global Business & Sustainability, and I am dedicated to make positive societal impact through tackling grand sustainability challenges. 

I am particularly interested in the social and environmental aspects of sustainability and I have an insatiable desire to learn new things and to develop myself further. 

I believe that every individual has a special power to make a difference in the world. It's collaborations however, that can move mountains.

education.field_of_study: Areas of specialization: Economics & Society and Culture & Society

awards.title: First place Smurfit Kappa Case
awards.description: Our team designed a model which would enhance the sustainable packaging performance of products. This workshop was organised by the Erasmus Recruitment Days.

awards.title: First place Unilever Case Competition
awards.description: Our team proposed creative solutions in order to attract a larger customer segment to Unilever's cleaning products as well as to enhance the sustainability of its products. The case competition was organised by Asset | IB&M at Tilburg University.

awards.title: First place Procureon Case
awards.description: Our team created solutions to incorporate lean management in the given business case. The case was part of the IBA Management Day organised by Asset | IB&M at Tilburg University.

projects.title: Rotterdam100 Social Impact Challenge
projects.description: This project contributes to making the city of Rotterdam more sustainable through the implementation of the Sustainable Development Goals in the form of innovative solutions. These can later be initiated by the municipality and have the potential to create lasting societal impact. I have been involved from start to finish, and tasks included amongst others brainstorming, creating a business model, branding and designing the prototype. Our idea made it into one of the final selections of the challenge.

projects.title: SDG Challenge
projects.description: I participated in a national competition in which 14 universities of the Netherlands worked together with companies on challenges related to the Sustainable Development Goals.  I was part of  the Tilburg University Team and collaborated with Enexis to create solutions for implementing sustainable offices through employee engagement. I was involved in the entire process; from brainstorming and generating solutions to deciding upon concrete actions and delivering the final presentation.

projects.title: The Bèkske Project
projects.description:
During the 100-day Commemoration of the Genocide against the Tutsi taking place from April - July 2019, we are organising several events to raise awareness of this cause among the local people of Tilburg and promote the Rwandan Coffee of the social enterprise 'Het Tilburgs- Rwandees Bèkske'. 

I am involved in organising the opening event on the campus of Tilburg University to kickstart the 100-days commemoration as well as working with the local partners Jumbo Foodmarket and Locals, to promote the coffee and organise a coffee tasting.

projects.title: Ethical Hackathon
projects.description: During an Ethical Hackathon organized by Enactus and the Entrepreneurs Society, my team had 52 hours to come up with a social enterprise which would resolve a climate change- related problem. Our focus was on mixed farming as opposed to intensive single crop farming, and besides partaking in brainstorming and researching, I was also responsible for creating the end product, reaching out to farmers and assessing the viability of the enterprise by executing a cost analysis.

projects.title: Community project MUSt
projects.description: The community project MUSt is set up by Outreaching students and stands for 'Moving University and Society together'. Our goal is to promote sustainability and environmentally friendly actions by raising awareness among people. Together, we try to make a difference in society by making a positive impact on others.

projects.title: Outreaching Lab 'From Gray to Green cities'
projects.description: In this project each teammember focused on a particular city to study the transition from gray and industrial, to more green and sustainable cities. I was responsible for analysing the city Nijmegen with its public-private partnerships (PPP) as the focal point of the research. At the end, I did a comparative analysis for all six cities in terms of similarities and differences among these cities.

profile_positions.description:
Stichting Kind & Onderwijs Rotterdam anticipates that the composition of the children population of their 26 schools will be affected long term, due to future developments in neighbourhoods in Rotterdam.  Developments such as city-wide new construction projects will likely affect the socialeconomic status of neighbourhoods in which the schools reside and Stichting Kind & Onderwijs wants to turn these developments into strategic opportunities. 

I have taken part in conducting research about the socialeconomic status of the neighbourhoods as well as forecasting and analysing the impact that new construction projects can have on the socialeconomic status. Additionally, I have developed strategic advice for the management of Stichting Kind & Onderwijs Rotterdam and all has been compiled into a report.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description: In partnership with consultancy firm WissemaGroup this project aims to progress corporate implementation of diversity and inclusivity policies. Factors that play a crucial role in facilitating or impeding diversity & inclusivity have been identified through survey research and interviews with various public- and private organisations. These insights have been converted into a diversity & inclusivity training for works councils.
profile_positions.title: SDG Trainee

profile_positions.description:
SOLVE Consulting is a student-led organisation that collaborates with various for-profit and non-profit organisations to increase their societal impact.

I have worked on a project in which the foundation Betrokken Student (BeSt) wants to give back to the city of Rotterdam through a generous donation that would help the youth in need. The project is designed to generate and develop concrete ideas regarding the investment project of the donation, whilst striving for youth impact maximisation. 
My tasks included research into the needs of youth in Rotterdam, contacting local organisations, brainstorming and developing ideas, and impact assessment.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

company.name: The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)

profile_positions.company: The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)
profile_positions.description:
I participated in the Global Circular Challenge-Fashion Can Do Better 2021 organised by LSE, which addresses one of the grand challenges that we face today: Sustainable fashion. The mission of the challenge is to enhance supply chain circularity in the fashion industry, from sourcing and manufacturing to disposability of fashion products now and in the future. 

Together with my team at Erasmus University, we immersed ourselves into this challenge alongside 100+ students from 18 leading universities worldwide. The weekly assignments founded on the circular economy principles of the Ellen MacArthur Foundation and design thinking principles of IDEO, as well as the lectures and feedback from key players in the industry helped our team to solidy our sustainable business model. My involvement extended from idea generation to business plan development and our solution made it to the finals of this competition.
profile_positions.title: Global Circular Challenge Participant

profile_positions.description: Life cycle assessments of a 100 MW wave power park of Seabased Norway and fixed offshore wind farm have been conducted to determine the carbon footprint across the six life cycle stages, which include production, transportation, installation, operation, maintenance and decommissioning. The two assessments were created in close collaboration with higher management and the data and findings have been incorporated in a report and an Excel database
profile_positions.title: Life Cycle Assessment Intern

profile_positions.description: The research carried out by Flow Impact Fund serves the action lab of the EUPCL (European Platform for Compassionate Leadership for Climate & Peace), which aims to accelerate green transition in Europe by empowering sustainable entrepreneurs in their scale-up efforts. My responsibilities involve analysing the European Green Deal in terms of emerging green sectors and markets in order to identify the sustainable scale-ups.
profile_positions.title: Sustainability Researcher

profile_positions.description: Responsible Business Leadership is a course of the IBA programme in which 1000+ students learn about topics concerning sustainability, authentic leadership, ethics and corporate social responsibility. Besides giving workshops to approximately 50 students, I also moderated ethical discussions and graded assignments.
profile_positions.title: Responsible Business Leadership Tutor

profile_positions.description:
As team leader, I have been responsible for guiding the team through the entire start-up process, further developing the business model for our initiative, building partnerships with local businesses as well as keeping close communication with the Enactus board. 

The transition between the old and new team took place over summer, during which I have guided the new Enactus Food Waste team in their onboarding journey and equipped them with relevant knowledge and practices.
profile_positions.title: Team leader Innovation Food Waste venture

profile_positions.description: The aim of this venture is to contribute to the reduction of food waste in Rotterdam through the development of sustainable initiatives. As a team member, I have been involved in carrying out research as well as developing the business model.
profile_positions.title: Team member Innovation Food Waste

profile_positions.description: I have conducted research regarding the legal requirements to formally register the social enterprise in the Netherlands, and have explored funding opportunities.
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: I have welcomed incoming students who have just arrived at the Eindhoven airport and I have assisted them in terms of transportation and finding their way to Tilburg University.
I assisted a first aid training at a local primary school.
The regenerative circle cares about the wellbeing of the community and I have been involved in organising activities around this.
